p: In recent years, the oxidative stress and its associated factors have gained importance in human health. This occurs due to the production of reactive oxygen species (ROS) (hydroxyl radicals, superoxide anion radicals and hydrogen peroxide) when the body is under stress [ 179]. This production results in imbalance processes, cell damage and health problems due to the overload of ROS that endogenous enzymatic and non-enzymatic antioxidant substances are not able to cope with [ 180]. This process often results in, among others, inflammatory diseases. Currently, inflammation is also one of the major researched areas for biomedical researchers [ 181]. The incorporation of antioxidant agents in diet from consumable natural plants can be used as preventive medicine for these disorders [ 181].
